title: Add tutorial to docs
body_html:
Hi,

I've used sphinx-gallery to make notebook styled examples to port ipython tutorial to sphinx documentation. I'm attaching a few screenshots to preview this without building it.



I think this is way more approachable than a notebook. Advantage is that you can still download a notebook with the code and the text! It's also much more maintainable.

If you like it, I can port rest of the tutorials like this.

Sasank.

body:
Hi,

I've used [sphinx-gallery](http://sphinx-gallery.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) to make [notebook styled examples](http://sphinx-gallery.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorials/plot_notebook.html#sphx-glr-tutorials-plot-notebook-py) to port ipython tutorial to sphinx documentation. I'm attaching a few screenshots to preview this without building it.

![screen shot 2017-02-18 at 2 25 20 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9305875/23091899/36c46288-f5e6-11e6-9a7b-07e6fece6762.png)
![screen shot 2017-02-18 at 2 25 36 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9305875/23091900/37102678-f5e6-11e6-9989-977fc7402c5f.png)
![screen shot 2017-02-18 at 2 25 59 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9305875/23091901/371058fa-f5e6-11e6-9904-ea0bf61992bf.png)

I think this is way more approachable than a notebook. Advantage is that you can still download a notebook with the code and the text! It's also much more maintainable.

If you like it, I can port rest of the tutorials like this. 

Sasank.
